grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 溶溶【ヨウヨウ】vast, overflowing with water, spacious
kun reading compounds: 溶ける【とける】to melt, to thaw, to fuse, to dissolve
溶かす【とかす】to dissolve, to melt
溶く【とく】to dissolve (paint), to scramble (eggs), to melt (metal, etc.), to mix (water with flour, etc.)
